item.title: Leif Erik add a quote by Jeanette Winterson
item.description: "Gambling is not a vice, it is an expression of our humanness. We gamble. Some do it at the gaming table, some do not. You play, you win, you play, you lose. You play. " -- Jeanette Winterson

item.title: Leif Erik add a quote by Susanna Clarke
item.description: "Can a magician kill a man by magic?” Lord Wellington asked Strange. Strange frowned. He seemed to dislike the question. “I suppose a magician might,” he admitted, “but a gentleman never would." -- Susanna Clarke

item.title: Leif Erik add a quote by André Gide
item.description: "Envying another man's happiness is madness; you wouldn't know what to do with it if you had it." -- André Gide

item.title: Leif Erik add a quote by André Gide
item.description: "You have to let other people be right' was his answer to their insults. 'It consoles them for not being anything else." -- André Gide

item.title: Leif Erik add a quote by Norman Cousins
item.description: "Death is not the greatest loss in life. The greatest loss is what dies inside us while we live." -- Norman Cousins

item.title: Leif Erik add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "It was like falling down an elevator shaft and landing in a pool full of mermaids." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Leif Erik add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "America...just a nation of two hundred million used car salesmen with all the money we need to buy guns and no qualms about killing anybody else in the world who tries to make us uncomfortable" -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Leif Erik add a quote by Paul Erdos
item.description: "A mathematician is a device for turning coffee into theorems" -- Paul Erdos

item.title: Leif Erik add a quote by Alexander Von Humboldt
item.description: "There are three stages of scientific discovery: first people deny it is true; then they deny it is important; finally they credit the wrong person." -- Alexander Von Humboldt

item.title: Leif Erik add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Men have become the tools of their tools." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Leif Erik add a quote by Henri Bergson
item.description: "The universe is a machine for the making of Gods." -- Henri Bergson

item.title: Leif Erik add a quote by Denis Diderot
item.description: "Whether God exists or does not exist, He has come to rank among the most sublime and useless truths." -- Denis Diderot

item.title: Leif Erik add a quote by George Carlin
item.description: "When you're born into this world, you're given a ticket to the freak show. If you're born in America you get a front row seat." -- George Carlin

item.title: Leif Erik add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "If it weren't for the people, the god-damn people' said Finnerty, 'always getting tangled up in the machinery. If it weren't for them, the world would be an engineer's paradise." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Leif Erik add a quote by Blaise Pascal
item.description: "The heart has its reasons which reason knows not." -- Blaise Pascal

item.title: Leif Erik add a quote by Eric Sevareid
item.description: "The chief cause of problems is solutions." -- Eric Sevareid

item.title: Leif Erik add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "Every generation imagines itself to be more intelligent than the one that went before it, and wiser than the one that comes after it." -- George Orwell

item.title: Leif Erik add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "First we thought the PC was a calculator. Then we found out how to turn numbers into letters with ASCII — and we thought it was a typewriter. Then we discovered graphics, and we thought it was a television. With the World Wide Web, we've realized it's a brochure." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Leif Erik add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Stories may well be lies, but they are good lies that say true things, and which can sometimes pay the rent." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Leif Erik add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "When I was a child, adults would tell me not to make things up, warning me of what would happen if I did. As far as I can tell so far, it seems to involve lots of foreign travel and not having to get up too early in the morning." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Leif Erik add a quote by Ludwig Wittgenstein
item.description: "Wovon man nicht sprechen kann, darüber muß man schweigen." -- Ludwig Wittgenstein

item.title: Leif Erik add a quote by China Miéville
item.description:
"It had become a chimney poking from a vertical universe of bookshelves.
There was motion below her. There were people on the shelves.
They clung to the edges of the cases and moved across them in expert scuttles. They wore ropes and hooks and carried picks on which they sometimes hung. Dangling from straps they carried notebooks, pens, magnifying glasses, ink pads, and stamps.
The men and women took books from the shelves as they went, checked their details, leaning against their ropes, replaced them, pulled out little pads and made notes, sometimes carried the books with them to another place and reshelved it there.
...
I'm Margarita Staples." She bowed in her harness. 'Extreme librarian. Bookaneer." -- China Miéville

item.title: Leif Erik add a quote by Plato
item.description: "Books are immortal sons defying their sires." -- Plato

item.title: Leif Erik add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "But the nature of the universe is such that the ends never justify the means. On the contrary, the means always determine the end." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: Leif Erik add a quote by Philip K. Dick
item.description: "Reality is that which, when you stop believing in it, doesn't go away." -- Philip K. Dick

item.title: Leif Erik add a quote by Bill Bryson
item.description: "When the poet Paul Valery once asked Albert Einstein if he kept a notebook to record his ideas, Einstein looked at him with mild but genuine surprise. "Oh, that's not necessary," he replied . "It's so seldom I have one." -- Bill Bryson

item.title: Leif Erik add a quote by Susan Ertz
item.description: "... millions long for immortality who don't know what to do with themselves on a rainy Sunday afternoon." -- Susan Ertz

item.title: Leif Erik add a quote by Jerome K. Jerome
item.description: "It is always the best policy to tell the truth, unless of course you are an exceptionally good liar." -- Jerome K. Jerome

item.title: Leif Erik add a quote by Pablo Picasso
item.description: "Computers are useless. They can only give you answers." -- Pablo Picasso

item.title: Leif Erik add a quote by Georges Clemenceau
item.description: "America is the only civilization in history which miraculously has gone directly from barbarism to degeneration without the usual interval of civilization" -- Georges Clemenceau
